sentence.Network_en: The girl may or may not outgrow her interest in fashion.
sentence.Network_cn: 这个女孩对时尚的兴趣可能会随着年龄的增长而消失，也可能不会。

sentence.Network_en: The little girl will outgrow her fear of pet animals.
sentence.Network_cn: 小女孩慢慢长大后就不会在怕宠物了.

sentence.Network_en: Children who walk in their sleep usually outgrow the habit.
sentence.Network_cn: 梦游的孩子通常在长大后这个习惯自然消失.

list.abs: if you outgrow the level-range of a fortress , you will not be able to attack , defend or rule it .如果您超出了要塞的等级范围，您将不能进行攻击、御或者统治。

we do not want to discredit or discount what you have used up until now as tools , we simply want you to outgrow your old tools .我们不是怀疑或不相信到现在还作为你所用过的工具，我们只是要你抛弃你的旧工具。
these mutant plants eventually outgrow the infection ., 这些变异植物最终成功抵抗了感染.

jx.jx_en_mean: (Brit.)become lanky and weak through excessively rapid growth

entry.def: If a child outgrows a piece of clothing, they grow bigger, so that it no longer fits them.

example.ex: She outgrew her clothes so rapidly that Patsy was always having to buy new ones.
example.tran: 她长得太快，衣服很快便穿不下了，帕齐只好经常给她买新衣服。
长大了穿不下的宝宝装

entry.tran: 因长大而放弃（以前的行为或想法）
entry.def: If you outgrow a particular way of behaving or thinking, you change and become more mature, so that you no longer behave or think in that way.

example.ex: The girl may or may not outgrow her interest in fashion.
example.tran: 这个女孩对时尚的兴趣可能会随着年龄的增长而消失，也可能不会。

means.word_mean: 1. grow too large or too mature for;

auth_sentence.content: You're unlikely to outgrow anaphylaxis and will need to take constant precautions.
auth_sentence.res_content: You're unlikely to outgrow anaphylaxis and will need to take constant precautions.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: You're unlikely to outgrow anaphylaxis and will need to take constant precautions.

auth_sentence.content: Finally, some dreamed, ordinary fans would outgrow their craving for star power.
auth_sentence.res_content: Finally, some dreamed, ordinary fans would outgrow their craving for star power.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Finally, some dreamed, ordinary fans would outgrow their craving for star power.

auth_sentence.content: She had told him this, although she suspected that he would outgrow Dick.
auth_sentence.res_content: She had told him this, although she suspected that he would outgrow Dick.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: She had told him this, although she suspected that he would outgrow Dick.

means.word_mean: 长〔发展〕 得超过(某物)的范围;长〔发展〕得不能再要(某物)

sentences.en: That boy outgrows his clothes every few months.
sentences.cn: 那男孩生长发育很快, 每隔几个月他的衣服就穿不下了。

means.word_mean: 长得比…快;生长速度超过

sentences.en: This variety of tomato outgrows all others.
sentences.cn: 这种品种的西红柿生长得比所有其他品种快。

sentences.en: She outgrew the company she worked for and found a better job somewhere else.
sentences.cn: 她进步很快, 不再满足于她所在工作的公司, 于是又在别处找到一份更好的工作。
